com.mysql.jdbc

Class FailoverConnectionProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mysql.jdbc.MultiHostConnectionProxy
      • com.mysql.jdbc.FailoverConnectionProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

    public class FailoverConnectionProxy
extends MultiHostConnectionProxy
    A proxy for a dynamic com.mysql.jdbc.Connection implementation that provides failover features for list of hosts. Connection switching occurs on communications related exceptions and/or user defined settings, namely when one of the conditions set in 'secondsBeforeRetryMaster' or 'queriesBeforeRetryMaster' is met.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  FailoverConnectionProxy.FailoverJdbcInterfaceProxy
      Proxy class to intercept and deal with errors that may occur in any object bound to the current connection.

        Throws:

      • failOver

        private void failOver(int failedHostIdx)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Initiates a default failover procedure starting at the given host index. This process tries to connect, sequentially, to the next host in the list. The primary host may or may not be excluded from the connection attempts.
        Parameters:
        failedHostIdx - The host index where to start from. First connection attempt will be the next one.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • fallBackToPrimaryIfAvailable

        void fallBackToPrimaryIfAvailable()
        Falls back to primary host or keep current connection if primary not available.

      • nextHost

        private int nextHost(int currHostIdx,
           boolean vouchForPrimaryHost)
        Gets the next host on the hosts list. Uses a round-robin algorithm to find the next element, but it may skip the index for the primary host. General rules to include the primary host are: - not currently connected to any host. - primary host is vouched (usually because connection to all secondary hosts has failed). - conditions to fall back to primary host are met (or they are disabled).
        Parameters:
        currHostIdx - Current host index.
        vouchForPrimaryHost - Allows to return the primary host index even if the usual required conditions aren't met.

      • incrementQueriesIssuedSinceFailover

        void incrementQueriesIssuedSinceFailover()
        Increments counter for query executions.

        boolean readyToFallBackToPrimaryHost()
